Title: Ed Cloud / EApp Defect - IP Flagged Spam Error
Details: Mentioned in System.History: @Samuel Anderson We found the root cause of this issue. There are more than one IP Address log record for a given fuzzy match IP address (For eg applications from IPs 250.250.250.1 and 250.250.250.2 are supposed to be linked to the same IP address log record. Instead It has two more records). In the example you shared, there are two fuzzy matching records (IP01547 | EApp Guest User Ip Address Log | Salesforce, IP22868 | EApp Guest User Ip Address

Title: PROD-Possible Round Robin Issue
Details: Mentioned in System.History: @Samuel Anderson Upon discussion with Nicola, she mentioned that when a record encounters an error, it is retried. During this process, the record is assigned to the next available user instead of the one it was originally intended for. Therefore, with each retry, the record is always allocated to the next available user.This appears to be the reason for the uneven distribution of contacts. However, they are still investigating the issue in more detail, and Nico

Title: Journey Pipeline Statistics Fail to Update After Application Submission
Details: Mentioned in System.History: @Kelly Avolio @Chris Van Der Merwe In this specific instance, what is causing the problem is that it appears that when the lead converts to an app, it triggers the Stage recalculate job, but doesn't update the statistics.
